name: places/ChIJdVCVHjf3wokRSECk3MT9aks
formattedAddress: 131 W 119th St, New York, NY 10026, USA
adrFormatAddress: 131 W 119th St, New York, NY 10026, USA

originalText.text:
A nightmare. Landlord is dismissive. No trash room for the first 3 months in the building and landlord's response was a dismissive "it's a new apartment." No live-in super.

Open kitchen. Large living room. Close to the 2/3 and b/c. The only closets are in the bedroom. In my opinion, the work on the building is done poorly. Dissolving grout. Peeling Paint. Facets falling off of the shower wall. Drafty windows that don’t fully close. Water in the shower is lukewarm. Some apartments with roof leaks. Some apartments with no heat in winter.

The Landlord will not answer your texts and the guy he says is the superintendent (I've never met him) won't either. So much drama and very little consideration for the fact that tenants live here. This is our home. Mailbox is outside which means stolen packages. The water from the faucets comes out with a chemical taste. Rent abatement but they asked me to pay full rent and receive a check for the difference. Seemed shady. There are better apartments in the neighborhood for cheaper prices with fewer issues.

originalText.text:
Poor management. Half the building moved out after a year b/c the landlords are insufferable. Based on my poor experience, I'm unlikely to work with Bohemia Realty ever again.

This is a good sized apartment with large but poorly insulated windows that are are extremely drafty. No hall closets. Mailbox is outside and I had thousands of dollars in packages disappear in a year. Slow repairs.

Ask the landlord to change a lightbulb b/c the lease said they would handle repairs? “Do it yourself. Not my job.” Need a toilet unclogged? “Not my job.” I had a washing machine repair take 6 weeks b/c the landlord didn’t communicate that he was delaying the process to seek a 2nd opinion. In fact, the first thing the landlord’s wife said to me about the repair was, "we didn't break it." Yet, the repairman said that the washer broke b/c the landlords had installed the wrong outlets. Other tenants in the building dealt with roof leaks and no heat during the winter.

Despite assurances from Bohemia Realty, the building was not ready when I moved in. My apartment had a missing cabinet and a hole in the ceiling that were never fixed.The landlords took 3 months to build a dedicated trash area. We had no intercom for weeks. I would forgive the timeline b/c of covid but, instead of apologizing for the issues and giving updates on the timeline, the landlords were rude. They asked us (last minute) to pay the entire rent and accept a check for the amount of the abatement to help with their refinancing process. However, if I asked for a heads up on when a repairman was coming to my apartment, the landlord would scoff, and say giving a time range was impossible.

Even as new landords during the pandemic,  they could have: sent a text or voicemail confirming receipt of a tenant request, made timely repairs, given clear updates about delays, and reasonable notice before the landlord or other repairman enters a tenants apartment. They could have designated someone to be on call for emergencies when the landlord is traveling (He's away often). None of this happened.

I reported a broken shower to the landlord in December. It wasn’t fixed until late March.  The slow response and hassle around repairs discouraged tenants from even reporting issues.

I lived alone in this apartment and I worked from home often. The landlord told me it was impossible to give me notice about repairmen and didn't seem to understand that, as a woman, I would feel safer if I could prepare my apartment before strange men enter. I also had MANY meetings interrupted.

Many tenants had irregular work schedules or worked from home, but the landlords never gave notice of loud repairs. Landords refused to show respect for tenants with even a notice via group text or a piece of paper hung in the hallway. One or two issues are forgivable but when it keeps happening AND the landlords are completely unreceptive to make free and easy demonstrations of respect and professionalism, it gets hard to be forgiving.

Untrustworthy

Landlord lied. I took the landlord to mediation over a repair bill and to try to improve tenant communication. I took the mediation very seriously and suggested free ways to improve the tenant experience. At mediation, the landlord told me that, as an apology, he would let me out of my lease early w/ no fee or penalty. He told me to write up any contract  and he would sign it. Grateful, I relied on his word, wrote a fair contract, and found another apartment.  Then, he and his wife ignored the contract I sent, blocked my calls for a week, and had the realtor from Bohemia Realty call me to say that I would only be let out of my lease if I paid out the year including the rent abatement ($12000. They'd make a $1000 profit). The entire situation was extremely weird b/c  the landlord himself made the initial offer and then repeatedly promised that there would be no penalty or fee.  The landlord either didn't take the mediation seriously or is untrustworthy

I would never rent with these unprofessional people again. I would never rent from Bohemia realty again.
